newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Taiwan jet tender flushed with offers, $201.50/tn.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan jet tender flushed with offers, $201.50/tn.

text.p: Taiwan's state-owned Chinese Petroleum Corp's (CPC) jet fuel purchase tender attracted more than 15 offers with the lowest said to be around $201.50-$202.00 per tonne, traders said on Friday.
The tender, which closed on May 22, is for July 1-30 delivery, on a cost-and-freight (c-and-f) basis to Keelung or Shen Ao.
The lowest offer was $2.00-$2.50 per tonne below the cargoes awarded in CPC's last tender for May 21-30 deliveries. CPC did not seek to buy any jet fuel for June delivery.
Traders said the lowest offer in this tender could have been made by a Singapore trader.
The tender will be awarded later this evening.
